title: Template Tasks Configuration
description: Configuration for template task automation and cleanup

name.description: Unique identifier name for this template. Must contain only lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens. Cannot start or end with a hyphen.

description.description: Detailed description of what this template does

dependencies.description: Names or identifiers of other templates that this template depends on

extends.description: Base template file(s) to extend from. Can be a local path or URL (http/https). Supports single path or array of paths.

oneOf.description: Single base template path or URL
Array of base template paths or URLs

variables.description: Top-level global variables available to all tasks. Variables are resolved once at startup and do not require user interaction.

prompts.description: Top-level global prompts collected once upfront and available to all tasks.

description.description: Detailed description of what the task does (optional, defaults to empty string)

required.description: Whether failure of this task should stop the process (optional, defaults to true)

enabled.description: Whether this task should be executed. Can be a boolean, a string expression, or a conditional expression based on variables or prompt values (optional, defaults to true).

dependencies.description: IDs of tasks that must run before this one

override.description: Strategy for merging with base task when extending templates

id.description: Unique identifier for the prompt value (must be a valid JavaScript identifier: start with letter, underscore, or $, followed by letters, digits, underscores, or $)

message.description: Prompt message to display to the user

required.description: Whether the prompt value is required (cannot be empty)

enabled.description: Whether this prompt should be displayed. Can be a boolean, a string expression, or a conditional expression based on variables or other prompt values.

oneOf.description: JavaScript expression to evaluate (shorthand for { condition: "..." }). Prompt only displays if expression evaluates to true.

condition.description: JavaScript expression to evaluate. Prompt only displays if condition evaluates to true. Has access to all variables and previously collected prompts.

default.description: Default value for the prompt. Can be a static value, an object with 'type' and 'value' properties for executable defaults, or a conditional default configuration.

oneOf.description: Static default value (string, number, or boolean)
Default value configuration for static or executable values

type.description: Type of default value. 'static' for explicit static values, 'exec' for command execution.

value.description: For 'static' type: the static value. For 'exec' type: the shell command to execute. Commands can be any shell command including git, npm, node, etc. The command output will be trimmed and auto-parsed as JSON, number, or boolean when applicable.

type.description: Type of default value. 'conditional' for condition-based defaults.

condition.description: JavaScript expression to evaluate. Can reference variables, prompts, and config values.

ifTrue.description: Value to use if condition evaluates to true. Can be a static value or a template string with {{variables}}.

ifFalse.description: Value to use if condition evaluates to false. Can be a static value or a template string with {{variables}}.

value.description: Value to use when this choice is selected

override.description: Strategy for merging with base prompt when extending templates. 'merge' (default) intelligently merges properties, 'replace' completely replaces the base prompt. Must be specified when prompt ID conflicts with base template.

id.description: Unique identifier for the variable (must be a valid JavaScript identifier: start with letter, underscore, or $, followed by letters, digits, underscores, or $)

value.description: Variable value. Can be a static value or an object with 'type' and 'value' properties for executable values.

oneOf.description: Value configuration for static or executable values

type.description: Type of value. 'static' for explicit static values, 'exec' for command execution.

value.description: For 'static' type: the static value. For 'exec' type: the shell command to execute. Commands output will be trimmed and auto-parsed as JSON, number, or boolean when applicable.

override.description: Strategy for merging with base variable when extending templates. 'merge' (default) replaces the value, 'replace' completely replaces the variable. Must be specified when variable ID conflicts with base template.

id.description: Unique identifier for the variable (must be a valid JavaScript identifier: start with letter, underscore, or $, followed by letters, digits, underscores, or $)

value.description: Variable value. Can be a static value or an object with 'type' and 'value' properties for executable values.

oneOf.description: Value configuration for static or executable values

type.description: Type of value. 'static' for explicit static values, 'exec' for command execution.

value.description: For 'static' type: the static value. For 'exec' type: the shell command to execute. Commands output will be trimmed and auto-parsed as JSON, number, or boolean when applicable.

file.description: Path to the JSON file to update

updates.description: Key-value pairs to update (supports nested paths with dot notation)

condition.description: Optional JavaScript expression to evaluate. Task only executes if condition evaluates to true.

file.description: Path to the file to create or overwrite

template.description: Inline template string with {{variable}} placeholders. Cannot be used with templateFile.

templateFile.description: Path to external template file (relative to project root). Files with .hbs extension automatically use Handlebars templating. Cannot be used with template.
